content:
It sounds like you've got a great cookbook that's opening up a world of flavors and cuisines to you! Global cuisine cookbooks can be so inspiring, and it's amazing that you're enjoying trying out new dishes from different cultures.

That's fantastic to hear that cooking has had a positive impact on your approach to food and meal planning! Meal prepping is such a great habit to get into, and it's awesome that you've found a system that works for you. Reducing food waste and making healthy eating easier are two huge benefits of meal prep. Plus, it's always exciting to have a stash of ingredients ready to go for the week.

Using a batch of cooked grains like rice, quinoa, or farro as a base for different meals is a great strategy. You can add different proteins, veggies, and spices to create a variety of dishes throughout the week. It's also a great way to get creative and experiment with new flavor combinations.

Do you find that you're saving time during the week by meal prepping, or is it more about the convenience and flexibility it offers? And have you noticed any changes in your overall health or energy levels since starting to cook more and meal prep?
